intro: Cynorkis brevicalcar, commonly known as the short-spurred orchid, is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is native to southern Africa. It is a terrestrial herb that typically grows in grassland or woodland habitats. The plant features a short, stocky rhizome with a cluster of narrow, linear leaves. Its flowers are small, with a distinctive spurred lip and are usually pale green or yellowish in color. Cynorkis brevicalcar is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, well-drained environments.
